text: there's a classic French spring dish of
asparagus and more Elmore ral being
little wild mushrooms that look
something like this but these are dried
Maurel I made some adaptations here it's
still pretty French but it's a lot
easier than the original and a lot
cheaper to being a French dish we're
going to start with a large lump of
butter fresh morels are hard to find and
they're really expensive dried morels
are also expensive but easy to find and
keep forever so you can buy quarter
pound or 1/2 pound or even a pound and
the last a long time
there's a lovely trick you can do
combining fresh and dried mushrooms
which I've done a lot with porcini this
is a dried porcini or a SEP as the
French call it and that is to combine
fresh mushrooms even button mushrooms
will work with some dried mushrooms and
the dried mushrooms and they're liquid
blend a lot of their flavor to the fresh
one so here we're using fresh shiitakes
which are much more flavorful than
button mushrooms we're gonna cook them
with a large pinch of salt and for
Morell's now the way you reconstitute
any dried mushroom is to take it and
soak it in boiling or at least really
hot water you see they're soft quite
flavorful not with the black intensity
of fresh Morell's we're really nice I
forgot that we wanted to put in some
chopped shallot or onion and we just
want to cook this all until the
mushrooms are tender which will take
another minute or so so the idea really
is that any fresh mushroom which are
cheap they can be as cheap as two or
three dollars a pound and any dried
mushroom which are expensive they can be
as much as a hundred and fifty dollars
to town combined will give you some of
the flavor of the dried mushroom in the
cheap fresh mushroom and if you start
with a decent fresh mushroom like
shiitakes so much the better
but as I said this will be fine with
button mushrooms too so what's going to
happen is the mushrooms are going to
give up their liquid and the
stur is gonna start to dry out as is
happening now at that point I'm gonna
add the mushrooms soaking liquid so
there's a ton of flavor in here you can

depends how much you use to soak the

a nice lively bubble add our asparagus
thick ones are good here too thin ones
are very nice
now we're gonna steam this for say two

to become tender beautiful might have

long also no just right now we're gonna

now you have shallot two kinds of

you can put a couple little tarragon
